title: Business & Finance
text:
The S&P 500 slumped to its worst weekly showing since February, ending Friday's session down 0.8%. The Dow and Nasdaq fell 0.8% and 0.9%, respectively.

---

Facebook's WhatsApp said it would extend encryption on the messaging service to backups of chats shared on the platform when they are stored on Apple and Google's cloud services.

---

Bank of America said it is installing new finance, technology and legal chiefs and adding three women to its senior ranks.

---

Brian Robbins, the head of ViacomCBS's Nickelodeon, is expected to take over as chairman and CEO of the company's Paramount movie studio.

---

Yahoo said it named digital-media veteran Jim Lanzone as its new chief executive.

---

Disney said the remainder of its films set to be released this year will be shown exclusively in theaters first.

---

UPS is getting into same-day delivery with a deal to buy Roadie.
